group.definition: (nautical, of a vessel) To sail before the wind, in distinction from reaching or sailing close-hauled.
To extend or persist, statically or dynamically, through space or time.
(transitive) To execute or carry out a plan, procedure or program.

usage.definition: Act or instance of running, of moving rapidly using the feet.
Act or instance of hurrying (to or from a place) (not necessarily by foot); dash or errand, trip.
Flight, instance or period of fleeing.
A group of fish that migrate, or ascend a river for the purpose of spawning.
